title: Drawing, Elevation of an altar retable for a project, ca. 1570-1600
title_raw: Elevation of an altar retable for a project
medium: incised lines; black chalk, pen, ink, brush, yellow, grayish brown water colors on paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Intended to be executed in stone, probably in gilt bronze parts. The mensa is outlined. The retable has a dado below with projecting lateral parts. The three main sections show framings of panels. Four fluted Doric pilasters at left support the the entablature. In the central interval is a niche with a standing shell in the concha. In the lateral intervals are what are probably smaller niches, with decorated dados below; with cherubim in panels above them. Laterally are butress volutes, with bunches of fruit hanging above. The triglyph frieze shows rosettes. On top is a low attic and vases containing fire standing upon the corners. In the center is a pediment consisting of a panel with a dove, between volutes and on top a circular pediment with a shell.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Elevation of an altar retable for a project, ca. 1570-1600. incised lines; black chalk, pen, ink, brush, yellow, grayish brown water colors on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2397.
